articles.headline: Boehner Retains Speaker’s Post, but Dissidents Nip at His Heels
articles.snippet: Representative John A. Boehner of Ohio was re-elected speaker of the House amid open dissent from conservatives that suggested the last Congress’s turmoil would live on.
articles.abstract: Representative John A. Boehner of Ohio was re-elected speaker of the House amid open dissent from conservatives that suggested the last Congress’s turmoil would live on.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Representative John A. Boehner of Ohio was narrowly re-elected speaker of the House on Thursday amid open dissent from conservatives on the House floor that signaled that the turmoil and division of the 112th Congress is likely to spill into the newly constituted 113th.

articles.headline: Obama Disputes Limits on Detainee Transfers Imposed in Defense Bill
articles.snippet: The president said he had the power to override a defense measure’s limits on the executive branch’s ability to transfer detainees out of military prisons.
articles.abstract: The president said he had the power to override a defense measure’s limits on the executive branch’s ability to transfer detainees out of military prisons.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama set aside his veto threat and late Wednesday signed a defense bill that imposes restrictions on transferring detainees out of military prisons in Afghanistan and Guantánamo Bay, Cuba. But he attached a signing statement claiming that he has the constitutional power to override the limits in the law.

articles.headline: A Victory for Google as F.T.C. Takes No Formal Steps
articles.snippet: A finding by the Federal Trade Commission that Google had not broken the law by highlighting its own services in search results could strengthen the firm’s already dominant position.
articles.abstract: A finding by the Federal Trade Commission that Google had not broken the law by highlighting its own services in search results could strengthen the firm’s already dominant position.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Federal Trade Commission on Thursday handed Google a major victory by declaring, after an investigation of nearly two years, that the company had not violated antitrust or anticompetition statutes in the way it arranges its Web search results.

articles.headline: Lessons From Europe on Averting Disaster
articles.snippet: The euro zone, despite some predictions, did not break up in 2012. Can a shared commitment to averting disaster carry over to Washington?
articles.abstract: The euro zone, despite some predictions, did not break up in 2012. Can a shared commitment to averting disaster carry over to Washington?
articles.lead_paragraph: Will the United States follow the European path in 2013?

articles.headline: Rig Owner Will Settle With U.S. in Gulf Spill
articles.snippet: Transocean, the driller whose Deepwater Horizon rig blew out in 2010 to cause a massive oil spill, agreed to a resolution of the federal government’s civil and criminal claims.
articles.abstract: Transocean, the driller whose Deepwater Horizon rig blew out in 2010 to cause a massive oil spill, agreed to a resolution of the federal government’s civil and criminal claims.
articles.lead_paragraph: The driller whose floating Deepwater Horizon oil rig blew out in 2010, causing a massive oil spill, has agreed to settle civil and criminal claims with the federal government for $1.4 billion, the Justice Department announced Thursday.

articles.headline: Inquiry Into Tech Giants’ Tax Strategies Nears End
articles.snippet: Companies like Apple have drawn scrutiny because of their penchant for shifting profits overseas, resulting in low American tax bills.
articles.abstract: Companies like Apple have drawn scrutiny because of their penchant for shifting profits overseas, resulting in low American tax bills.
articles.lead_paragraph: Congressional investigators are wrapping up an inquiry into the accounting practices of Apple and other technology companies that allocate revenue and intellectual property offshore to lower the taxes they pay in the United States.
articles.byline: By Charles Duhigg and David Kocieniewski

articles.headline: S.E.C. Ends Scrutiny of Former Top Aide to Buffett
articles.snippet: The Securities and Exchange Commission has decided not to file insider trading charges against David L. Sokol, a onetime top lieutenant at Berkshire Hathaway and aide to Warren E. Buffett, according to Mr. Sokol’s lawyer, Barry Wm. Levine.
articles.abstract: The Securities and Exchange Commission has decided not to file insider trading charges against David L. Sokol, a onetime top lieutenant at Berkshire Hathaway and aide to Warren E. Buffett, according to Mr. Sokol’s lawyer, Barry Wm. Levine.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Securities and Exchange Commission has decided not to file insider trading charges against David L. Sokol, a onetime top lieutenant at Berkshire Hathaway, Mr. Sokol’s lawyer said Thursday.

articles.headline: Lawyers, Saying DNA Cleared Inmate, Pursue Access to Data
articles.snippet: Attorneys for a man incarcerated for 10 years for a rape say his exoneration by DNA evidence, after months of litigation, proves such data must be made available to defense lawyers.
articles.abstract: Attorneys for a man incarcerated for 10 years for a rape say his exoneration by DNA evidence, after months of litigation, proves such data must be made available to defense lawyers.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOUNT OLIVE, W.Va. — Convicted of robbing and raping an 83-year-old woman, Joseph A. Buffey at 19 was no one’s idea of a choirboy. A marijuana smoker and high school dropout, he was out thieving on the night in question 11 years ago and broke into the Salvation Army near the woman’s home to steal the bell-ringing money.

articles.headline: Gore Went to Bat for Al Jazeera, and Himself
articles.snippet: Al Gore used the same arm-twisting he employed to build up Current TV to persuade cable distributors to keep showing it after it was sold to Al Jazeera.
articles.abstract: Al Gore used the same arm-twisting he employed to build up Current TV to persuade cable distributors to keep showing it after it was sold to Al Jazeera.
articles.lead_paragraph: Al Gore’s Current TV was never popular with viewers, but it was a hit where it counted: with cable and satellite providers. When he co-founded the channel in 2005, Mr. Gore managed to get the channel piped into tens of millions of households — a huge number for an untested network — through a combination of personal lobbying and arm-twisting of industry giants.

articles.headline: Google Pushed Hard Behind the Scenes to Convince Regulators
articles.snippet: Executives made frequent trips to Washington to press their case in an antitrust inquiry, laying out legal arguments and applying lessons from Microsoft’s bruising 1990s battle.
articles.abstract: Executives made frequent trips to Washington to press their case in an antitrust inquiry, laying out legal arguments and applying lessons from Microsoft’s bruising 1990s battle.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — For 19 months, Google pressed its case with antitrust regulators investigating the company. Working relentlessly behind the scenes, executives made frequent flights to Washington, laying out their legal arguments and shrewdly applying lessons learned from Microsoft’s bruising antitrust battle in the 1990s.
articles.byline: By Claire Cain Miller and Nick Wingfield

articles.headline: Job Creation Is Still Steady Despite Worry
articles.snippet: Employers added 155,000 jobs in December, about apace with job growth over the last year, the Labor Department reported on Friday. The unemployment rate was 7.8 percent.
articles.abstract: Employers added 155,000 jobs in December, about apace with job growth over the last year, the Labor Department reported on Friday. The unemployment rate was 7.8 percent.
articles.lead_paragraph: Despite concerns about looming tax increases and government spending cuts, American employers added 155,000 jobs in December. Employees also enjoyed slightly faster wage growth and worked longer hours, which could bode well for future hiring.
